Pre-Game Insights: Superstars like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli will return to the squad for the Men in Blue.
Charith Asalanka will kick-start his ODI captaincy after a disappointing T20I series where the Lankans suffered three consecutive defeats.
India starts the ODI series as a heavy favourite with a star-studded squad against Sri Lanka.
The Indian batting boasts some world-class players like Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, Shubhman Gill and others who have been in incredible form in the 50-over format.
On the bowling front, Mohammed Siraj will spearhead the attack alongside Kuldeep Yadav, who could dominate in the Lankan spin-friendly conditions.
Sri Lanka had a dismal performance in the T20I series with their batting failing to hold its own in each fixture.
The Lankan batting will be in for a tough challenge and the likes of Pathum Nissanka, Kusal Mendis, Sadeera Samarawickrama and Charith Asalanka will be crucial for the team’s chances.
Maheesh Theekshana and Matheesha Pathirana will be the biggest threats for India while Dunith Wellalage will look to repeat his heroics from the Asia Cup 2023 against the Men in Blue.
Miscellaneous Highlights: All three One-Days will be played at the R.Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.
